description: From Middle English imparten, borrowed from Middle French impartir, empartir, from Late Latin impartiō, impertiō, from im- (“in”) + Latin partiō (“divide”).

verbs.description: impart (third-person singular simple present imparts, present participle imparting, simple past and past participle imparted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give or bestow (e.g. a quality or property).
examples: to impart food to the poor

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give a part or to share.
examples: Synonyms: bequeath, bestow, give; see also Thesaurus:give

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make known; to show (by speech, writing etc.).
examples: Synonyms: disclose, tell; see also Thesaurus:announce, Thesaurus:inform

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To hold a conference or consultation.
(transitive) To obtain a share of; to partake of.
examples: Sweet Cossen, what we may not now impart, heere let vs bury it, closely in our hart
